refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The max operator calculates the maximum of the specified attribute in the array. Result is an array with single element containing the maximum of the specified attribute.

note.para: The max operator provides the same functionality as the max aggregate. For details, see the max aggregate reference.

informalexample.para: This example find the maximum value of each row of a 2-dimensional array.

step.para: Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3:--afl CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0]; --show-output=no
Store values of 0â€“8 in m3x3:--afl store(build(m3x3,i*3+j),m3x3); --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes
Select the maximum value of each row of m3x3:--afl max(m3x3,val,i); --output-format=dense
